Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he intensively pursued before his death, and the tremendous chaos and despair in the world after the Japanese defeat in war. This juxtaposition of weakness and strength, good and evil, disorder and chaos, ideology and positivity

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "Hardcore" (1979) by Jim Sharman but I was pretty disappointed by that one. I think I prefer “Les Valseuses” as I enjoy the story with its crazy characters.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, whom her son adopt, is possessed by the spirit of an ancient Phoenix ; the phoenix will return to power, when she and her son get older.
